verses.roman:
rāmadāsa abhirāma--sakhya-premarāśi
ṣolasāṅgera kāṣṭha tuli' ye karila vāṅśī

synonyms: rāmadāsa abhirāma—of the name Rāmadāsa Abhirāma; sakhya-prema—friendship; rāśi—great volume; ṣolasa-aṅgera—of sixteen knots; kaṣṭha—wood; tuli'-lifting; ye—one who; karila—made; vāṅśī—flute.
translation: Rāmadāsa Abhirāma was fully absorbed in the mellow of friendship. He made a flute of a bamboo stick with sixteen knots.

purport.content: Abhirāma was an inhabitant of Khānākula-kṛṣṇa-nagara.
